name: Atlas Blender Add-on Integration
oneLiner: Developed a Blender add-on that integrates Atlas AI workflows into Blender’s UI, enabling workflow discovery, schema-driven configuration, asynchronous execution, job history review, and direct import of generated results into Blender.
bulletpoints: Built a Blender add-on that follows the same workflow lifecycle as the Unity and Unreal integrations: discovery, configuration, execution, and job history review.
Implemented schema-driven parameter panels and validated inputs within Blender’s UI constraints while preserving a consistent workflow identity.
Handled asynchronous job execution and imported generated outputs into Blender data blocks for immediate use in scenes and materials.

deepDive.problem: Blender add-ons must integrate into Blender’s UI and data model while supporting iterative, networked workflow execution and making generated outputs immediately usable by artists.
approach: Designed a Blender add-on architecture that mirrors the same workflow lifecycle used in Unity and Unreal while remaining Blender-native in interaction and layout.
Generated schema-driven parameter UI using Blender panels and properties, including validation to prevent invalid submissions.
Implemented asynchronous job execution with reliable feedback and persistent job tracking suitable for iterative production use.
Imported generated outputs into Blender data blocks (meshes, images, materials) so results become immediately available in the viewport and shader workflows.
